item.title: How to use pnpm: a simple guide
item.description:
1 What is pnpm?

pnpm is a package manager for JavaScript. It is like npm or yarn, but it is faster and uses less disk space.

Why?

  • pnpm saves only one copy of each version of a package.
  • Many projects can share the same files.
  • This makes your computer cleaner and faster.

item.title: Python Decorators: A Simple Guide
item.description:
Python Decorators: A Simple Guide

1 What is a Decorator?

A decorator in Python is a function that modifies the behavior of another function. It adds extra functionality without changing the original function code.

2 Why Use Decorators?

Decorators help you:

  • Reuse code
  • Keep functions clean
  • Add logging, timing, or access control
  • Make your code more readable

item.title: How to Manage Software with Flatpak on Ubuntu 22.04
item.description:
Introduction to Flatpak on Ubuntu 24.04

Flatpak is a system for running applications on Linux in a secure and isolated way. It works on many Linux distributions, including Ubuntu 24.04. Flatpak makes it easy to install apps without worrying about missing dependencies. It also allows apps to be updated easily.

item.title: Virtual environment in Python 3
item.description:
1 What is a virtual environment?

A virtual environment is a separate Python environment. It is isolated from your system’s Python environment. It lets you install Python packages and libraries. These packages don’t affect other projects or your system’s Python.

item.title: Exploring the split Command
